title: [FR] Clearer pagination UI in Registered Models view

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server

body: ### Willingness to contribute No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time. ### Proposal Summary The Registered Models pagination feature should indicate the existance of multiple pages in a clear way. Currently it's almost impossible to realize there are multiple pages, as you can see in the below screenshot: the only difference is that the arrow is in black instead of gray. Please show multiple page numbers (as in Google search, for example), or at least make the indication of the "next page" button clearer. [Note I'm using mlflow 1.26 for the UI so maybe this has been improved in recent versions] ### Motivation > #### What is the use case for this feature? Looking for registered models when more than 10 models are registered. > #### Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general? Pagination is currently not intuitive; it's easy to miss it and thus think your models weren't registered. > #### Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization? To get easier navigation and avoid possible mistakes. > #### Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? It requires a small UI change, shouldn't be difficult at all. ### Details _No response_ ### What component(s) does this bug affect? - [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging - [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow - [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages - [ ] `area/examples`: Example code - [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry - [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors - [ ] `area/recipes`: Recipes, Recipe APIs, Recipe configs, Recipe Templates - [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends - [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs - [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend - [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging ### What interface(s) does this bug affect? - [X] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server - [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models - [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry - [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support ### What language(s) does this bug affect? - [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients - [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients - [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages ### What integration(s) does this bug affect? - [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations - [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations - [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
